user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_SymbolLookup_Static:
```c
int32 OS_SymbolLookup_Static(cpuaddr *SymbolAddress, const char *SymbolName, const char *ModuleName)
{
    int32                      return_code = OS_ERR_NOT_IMPLEMENTED;
    OS_static_symbol_record_t *StaticSym   = OS_STATIC_SYMTABLE_SOURCE;

    while (StaticSym != NULL)
    {
        if (StaticSym->Name == NULL)
        {
            /* end of list --
             * Return "OS_ERROR" to indicate that an actual search was done
             * with a not-found result, vs. not searching at all. */
            return_code = OS_ERROR;
            break;
        }
        if (strcmp(StaticSym->Name, SymbolName) == 0 &&
            (ModuleName == NULL || strcmp(StaticSym->Module, ModuleName) == 0))
        {
            /* found matching symbol */
            *SymbolAddress = (cpuaddr)StaticSym->Address;
            return_code    = OS_SUCCESS;
            break;
        }

        ++StaticSym;
    }

    return return_code;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
while (StaticSym != NULL)
    {
        if (StaticSym->Name == NULL)
        {
            /* end of list --
             * Return "OS_ERROR" to indicate that an actual search was done
             * with a not-found result, vs. not searching at all. */
            return_code = OS_ERROR;
            break;
        }
        if (strcmp(StaticSym->Name, SymbolName) == 0 &&
            (ModuleName == NULL || strcmp(StaticSym->Module, ModuleName) == 0))
        {
            /* found matching symbol */
            *SymbolAddress = (cpuaddr)StaticSym->Address;
            return_code    = OS_SUCCESS;
            break;
        }

        ++StaticSym;
    }
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation. All statements in the loop are reachable depending on runtime data: the while loop executes only when StaticSym != NULL; the first if (Name == NULL) handles a sentinel and breaks out; the strcmp-based branch is reachable when the symbol matches; and the ++StaticSym advances the scan. There are no statements that cannot be reached at runtime, so Rule 2.1 is not violated.
